SharedMem:
["Pat asks his friend Greg to help by carrying a vase of water to the table.", 
"Greg isn’t very careful, slips, and nearly drops the vase.", 
"The vase breaks and spills water everywhere despite a last-minute attempt to save it."]
ScenarioPremise: After the vase breaks, Pat says to their friend, “Smart move.”
Options:
["To say that he was actually very agile", 
"To say he's sorry", 
"To wait for an answer", 
"To say that unfortunately it did not help to save the vase"]
LcGoal: Pat wants the vase to be safely brought to the table
LcContext: Pat’s friend nearly drops the vase

SharedMem:

 "This morning, Sara didn’t hear the alarm and is rushing to avoid being late.",
 "While preparing breakfast, she accidentally spills a cup of tea, breaking it and spilling tea on the floor."]
ScenarioPremise: After the cup breaks and tea spills, Sara says, “That's just what I needed today!”

 "To say he is sorry for her bad day",
 "To wait for an answer",
 "To say it is fortunate that she can work from home"]
LcGoal: Sara wants to get to work on time
LcContext: Sara is rushing after waking up late
LcSpecificMem: Sara feels stressed because she’s running behind

IlcContext: Brian woke up after the accident
IlcSpecificMem: Brian doesn't know if Sara is still there because she wants to work from home
IlcExtras: Brian isn’t involved in the morning rush

Model_lc_action: To ask if she can work from home
known_effect_lc: Sara felt anxious as she approached her supervisor to request permission to work from home, knowing that this decision could significantly impact her work status and location.

SharedMem:
["Tim is a 14-year-old boy who wants to go out with his friends to eat ice cream.",
 "Tim decides to ignore the weather forecast and leaves without the umbrella."]
ScenarioPremise: After Tim returns home wet, he tells his mother it rained, and she replies, “Well, what a surprise.”
Options:
["To say he thought it would rain later",
"To say he should have taken the umbrella",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say that the weather forecast was wrong"]
LcGoal: Tim's mother wants Tim to avoid getting wet
LcContext: Tim's mother suggested Tim to check the weather forecast
LcSpecificMem: Tim's mother knows it may rain but leaves the decision to Tim
LcExtras: Tim's mother is at home when Tim returns
IlcGoal: Tim wants to go out with friends
IlcSpecificMem: Tim was convinced that the rain would come after he got home
IlcExtras: Tim is a bit embarrassed by the outcome
Explicit_belief_illocutor: Tim knows that his mother knew it might rain but left the decision to Tim
Illocutor_answer: To say he thought it would rain later
Model_lc_action: To say he should have taken the umbrella
known_effect_lc: Tim felt a wave of regret wash over him as he recalled his mother's attempt to remind him to take the umbrella before he left. Now, with the rain approaching, he couldn't shake the feeling that he should have listened to her advice and been better prepared
